meanings.definition: A downward displacement of rock strata in a geological fault.
meanings.sent1: The downthrow of the rocks created a deep valley.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the downthrow of the fault line.
meanings.sent3: The downthrow of the rocks made the geologist's job more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The downthrow of the rocks was like nature's own staircase.
meanings.sent5: The downthrow of the rocks was so sudden, it startled the hikers.

meanings.definition: To throw or cause to fall down forcefully.
meanings.sent1: He downthrows the ball with great force.
meanings.sent2: She downthrows the opponent in a wrestling match.
meanings.sent3: The magician downthrows the cards in a mesmerizing way.
meanings.sent4: The storm downthrows trees like they are mere twigs.
meanings.sent5: The chef downthrows the dough to prepare the pizza crust.
